title: Quiz 4: Org. Communication - Meetings
description: Assess your understanding of meeting procedures, agendas, minutes, and leadership roles.

questions.question: An ___BLANK___ is a statement of matters/issues to be discussed in a meeting, listed in proper sequence.
questions.explanation: An agenda outlines the plan for the meeting.
questions.hint: The list of things to do.

questions.question: Match the meeting role with the correct responsibility:

pairs.right: Calls meeting to order and maintains discipline
Records minutes and circulates attendance list

questions.explanation: The Chairman leads, the Secretary records, and Participants contribute.
questions.hint: Who holds the gavel? Who holds the pen?

questions.question: Arrange the standard Agenda items in the correct logical order:

items.text: Confirmation of minutes of previous meeting

questions.explanation: The standard flow: Welcome -> Old Business -> Matters Arising -> New Business -> AOB -> Close.

questions.question: What information must be included in the 'Minutes' of a meeting? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Names of those present and absent (apologies)
Verbatim transcript of every word spoken

questions.explanation: Minutes are a summary of decisions and proceedings, not a word-for-word transcript.

questions.question: What is the term for the minimum number of participants required to be present for a meeting to officially start?
questions.explanation: A quorum is the minimum attendance required to conduct official business.

questions.question: The approval of minutes is proposed by a member who did NOT attend the previous meeting.
questions.explanation: Minutes must be proposed and seconded by members who ATTENDED the previous meeting to verify accuracy.
questions.hint: How can you verify if you weren't there?

questions.question: What does 'A.O.B.' stand for in an agenda?
questions.explanation: A.O.B. stands for Any Other Business, usually for minor items not on the main agenda.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of the Chairman?
questions.explanation: Taking minutes is the responsibility of the Secretary, not the Chairman.

questions.question: When preparing for a public meeting, what factor should be avoided when selecting a date?
questions.explanation: Market days should be avoided as many community members will be busy buying/selling.

questions.question: Why is an agenda important? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Ensures no listed item is omitted
Ensures matters are discussed in sequence

questions.explanation: Agendas provide structure and preparation, but they do not guarantee agreement.
